data.name: Animation
data.info: The animation I've implemented is clunky. using the core CSS animation with classes, should be able to clean this up with ngAnimate.

data.name: Custom Directives?
data.info: Nope. Nada. Zilch. The bubble animation should all be handled with the ngAnimate library or custom directives. If I have time, this is the next thing I want to revisit.

data.name: Services, Services and Events
data.info: This started as a pure hack to look at CSS animation. If I have the time I need to rewrite all the logic. As it is, I took all the $rootScope mess and moved code to services, which cleaned it up. I still needed cross-controller communication so I have some event broadcasters and listeners. The proper way to do this would be to design, or at least imagine, a database and layout the Services like a REST or DAO layer.

data.name: Unit Tests
data.info: There are some BASIC unit tests, not even close to really covering the code.. On the flip side this is a playground concept: I do not expect anyone in their right mind to take this and run with it.

data.name: Dynamic Colors
data.info: Bubbles should only nest two or three deep. However I would still like to calculate the colors based on number of parent categories and the levels down into the search.

data.name: Dynamic Placement
data.info: Bubbles are tied to a predifined div and location on the screen. these should be dynamic and self organizing relative to each other's location.

data.name: Weird Bug
data.info: In the browser console when loading the Search view, there's a 404. Apparently this is coming from the ng-repeats for the businesses that load an image. The collections are empty, so not sure why it is attempting to load the image src.
